## Framework.when property

Executes a function if a given test is `true`.

Signature:

```typescript
when: methods.when;
```

## Remarks

- The first parameter is the conditional check. - The second parameter is the function to run if `true`. - The third parameter is optional; executed if the conditional is not `true`.

## Example 1

Only produce a vendor bundle when running in `production` [Mode](/api/bud-framework/mode):

```js
bud.when(bud.isProduction, () => bud.vendor());
```

## Example 2

Use `eval` sourcemap in development mode and `hidden-source-map` in production:

```js
bud.when(
  bud.isDevelopment,
  () => bud.devtool("eval"),
  () => bud.devtool("hidden-source-map")
);
```
